business.headline: Who is Ravi Ahuja, the incoming CEO of Sony Pictures?As he steps into the CEO role, Ravi Ahuja will succeed Tony Vinciquerra, who will remain with SPE as a non-executive chairman until December 2025.

Check latest interest rates on PPF, SCSS, SSY and more The post office savings schemes included in this decision are the Public Provident Fund (PPF), Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS), Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), and a few others.

Consumers await fuel price relief as OMCs pocket huge gainsDespite falling crude prices and record profits, consumers are still waiting for meaningful reductions in fuel prices, even as oil marketing companies are reaping huge benefits.

Google pays $2.7 billion to bring back AI visionary Noam ShazeerNoam Shazeer, 48, was one of Google's early hires, joining the company in 2000. A talented software engineer, Shazeer made his mark in AI, becoming a key figure in Google's early AI development.

India's factory growth cools to eight-month low in SeptemberNew orders - a key gauge of demand - grew at the weakest pace since December, though were still robust, while output was at an eight-month low.

Diffusion Engineers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDiffusion Engineers IPO allotment status: Investors can check their allotment status through the online portals of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd, the registrar for the IPO.

Gold, silver price today, October 1, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today October 1, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT and auto stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 147.39 points to 84,447.17 at 10:02 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.75 points to trade at 25,845.60.

New PPF rules effective today: All you need to know New PPF rules effective today streamline account management for minors, multiple account holders, and NRIs, impacting interest rates and regulations.

Stock market changes effective today: 3 things investors need to knowThree key updates effective today will impact transaction fees, Securities Transaction Tax, and share buyback taxation for stock market investors.

Bloodbath on D-Street: Sensex slips 1,200 points; investors lose Rs 4 lakh croreThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,272.07 points to 84,299.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 361.65 points lower at 25,810.85.

Ola Electric shares slip below Rs 100. Buy the dip or avoid? The stock was down 2.59% at Rs 99.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking a sharp decline from its record high of Rs 157.53 on August 20, 2024.

Indian Oil Corporation withdraws Rs 22,000 crore rights issueIOC decided to withdraw the rights issue following the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas (MoP&NG) informing that no funds have been allocated for capital support to Oil Marketing Companies (OMCs) in the 2024-25 budget.

Sebi board meeting today. What's on the agenda?On the agenda are discussions surrounding tighter norms for Futures & Options (F&O) trading, the introduction of a 'New Asset Class,' and the much-anticipated mutual fund lite regulations.

Manba Finance lists at 25% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell? Will Manba Finance shares continue to rise after listing on Dalal Street or is it time to cash in on your gains? Here's all you need to know.

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO allotment: Step-by-Step guide to check statusKRN Heat Exchanger IPO allotment: Investors who participated in the KRN Heat Exchanger IPO can check their allotment status through the websites of the Bombay Stock Exchange and Bigshare Services.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points. What's making D-Street bulls nervous?Stock market crash: The Sensex was down 1,018.81 points to 84,553.04 at 11:50 am and the Nifty50 tanked 290.20 points to trade at 25,888.75.

Ashneer Grover settles with BharatPe after ugly legal battle, ends ties to firmThe resolution comes after a tumultuous period marked by allegations of financial misconduct against Ashneer Grover and his family during his tenure at BharatPe.

Mark Zuckerberg becomes world's fourth-richest person, enters $200 billion clubMark Zuckerberg's net worth has surged to $200 billion, positioning him as the fourth-richest person globally, right behind Amazon founder Jeff Bezos,, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and LVMH Chairman Bernard Arnault.
Income tax audit report deadline extended to October 7. Who benefits? Income tax audit report deadline: Originally set for September 30, 2024, the new deadline is now October 7, 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Be it temple or dargah, it has to go: Supreme Court on encroachmentThe Supreme Court was hearing petitions challenging bulldozer action against people accused of crimes -- a move often referred to as 'bulldozer justice'.

Nasrallah suffocated to death from toxic fumes inside bunker: ReportHassan Nasrallah, the elusive chief of Hezbollah who headed the Iran-backed Hezbollah for 32 years, was killed on September 27 in a massive Israeli airstrike that hit the militant group's headquarters in Beirut.

Masterstroke by Israel: Indian Army chief on Lebanon pager blast operationLast month, multiple explosions of pagers and walkie-talkies of Hezbollah members in Lebanon killed nearly 40 and left over 3,000 injured.

Disabled UK journalist crawls on flight after airline fails to give wheelchairRenowned British journalist Frank Gardner had to crawl across the cabin floor of a LOT Polish Airlines flight due to the airline's lack of onboard wheelchair facilities.

Lucknow man orders pricey smartphones via cash on delivery, kills delivery agentAfter receiving the smartphones, Gajanan and his accomplice allegedly strangled the delivery agent, then put his body in a sack and dumped it in the Indira Canal.

Govinda's 1st statement after bullet injury: Thank you for praying, I feel betterActor Govinda released an audio message after accidentally shooting himself in the leg with his licenced revolver on Tuesday, October 1.

67 cases against seer over Prophet Mohammed remarks, Bombay High Court toldThe government told the court that the objectionable material containing Mahant Ramgiri Maharaj's alleged derogatory remarks, which was shared online, is being taken down by the cyber crime police.

Mount Everest is surprisingly growing taller While the Himalayas have been rising for approximately 50 million years due to the collision of the Indian and Eurasian tectonic plates, scientists have discovered that Everest is growing even faster than expected.

Rajinikanth's health update: Actor stable after elective procedureSuperstar Rajinikanth underwent an elective procedure at a private hospital on Tuesday, October 1. He is currently in a stable condition.

Why one nation, one election is ringing in USThe concept of 'one nation, one election' that has been a political talking point in India, is creating waves in the US, albeit for different reasons. In India, the ruling NDA government is pushing for simultaneous polls, while in the US, right-wing voices like Elon Musk warn that a Democratic win could lead to a single-party election.

Israeli troops enter Hezbollah tunnels amid ongoing ground raids in Lebanon  Live UpdatesIn its statement, the Israel Defense Forces said the Hezbollah targets were located in villages close to the Israel-Lebanon border and "pose an immediate threat to Israeli communities in northern Israel".

No toilets, no shelter: Displaced woman sleeps on Beirut streets with childrenAmid the continuous attacks by Israel in southern Lebanon, many people in the Middle Eastern country have been displaced from their homes and are yet to find safe places. India Today TV's Ashraf Wani spoke to one such woman. Bassma, who was displaced from her home in South Lebanon, said that she has not been able to find any shelter and toilet for herself and her daughters in Beirut. Israel's attack has killed 569 people, including 50 children, and wounded 1,835 in Lebanon. Meanwhile, the UNSC has called a meeting on Wednesday to discuss the conflict. "Lebanon is at the brink. The people of Lebanon – the people of Israel – and the people of the world - cannot afford Lebanon to become another Gaza," news agency Reuters quoted UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres as saying while speaking on the issue. At the UN, which is holding its General Assembly this week, US President Joe Biden made a plea for calm. "Full-scale war is not in anyone's interest. Even if a situation has escalated, a diplomatic solution is still possible," he said.

Jammu and Kashmir votes in final phase of Assembly polls, 28.12% turnout so far Live UpdatesOn Tuesday, voters from 40 assembly constituencies — 24 in Jammu division and 16 in Kashmir division — will decide the fate of 415 candidates, including prominent leaders such as former deputy chief ministers Tara Chand and Muzaffar Beig.

Unacceptable: Rahul Gandhi, Opposition condemn Sonam Wangchuk's detentionCongress MP Rahul Gandhi asked why elderly people standing up for the future of Ladakh were being detained by the police at the Delhi border.

'Trump took my dad', says Rudy Giuliani's daughter as she backs Kamala HarrisOn September 23, a federal appeals court permanently disbarred Rudy Giuliani from practising law in Washington D.C. for the efforts he made to discredit the 2020 election results and prevent the transition of power after Trump lost the polls.

Retired IAS officer reveals first salary TCS Mumbai offered him 40 years agoRetired IAS officer Rohit Kumar Singh shared a glimpse of his journey as he revealed his first salary that TCS Mumbai had offered him 40 years ago.

Congress to interview Maharashtra poll picks amid INDIA seat-sharing talks: SourcesCongress sources said the party has appointed leaders Sangram Thopate and Satej Patil to interview the Mumbai candidates and 34 senior functionaries for the rest of Maharashtra.

Gurmeet Ram Rahim to leave jail ahead of Haryana polls, 15th parole in 4 yearsGurmeet Ram Rahim's furloughs and paroles have consistently coincided with elections, be it to municipal bodies or state assemblies.

With 'Laapataa Ladies' campaign, Congress takes aim at Eknath Shinde governmentThe Congress campaign, which comes in the wake of a case of sexual abuse involving two schoolgirls in Badlapur, criticises the Eknath Shinde government's alleged failures in ensuring women's safety.

Archana Puran Singh recalls being asked to laugh on sets after mother-in-law's deathActor Archana Puran Singh recently shared a difficult experience where she had to continue laughing on the set of a comedy show despite learning of her mother-in-law's death. She stated that she felt obligated to fulfill her professional commitments.

Man tracks stolen Ferrari worth Rs 5 crore using AirPods he accidentally left in his car A man in Connecticut used Apple's 'Find My' feature to track down his stolen Ferrari worth Rs 5 crore, thanks to a pair of AirPods he accidentally left inside the car.

New PPF rules effective today: All you need to know New PPF rules effective today streamline account management for minors, multiple account holders, and NRIs, impacting interest rates and regulations.

People should drink 'gaumutra' before entering Garba pandals, says BJP leaderBJP district president of Indore said that if someone is Hindu, they won't object to drinking cow urine. He suggested that Navratri organisers should make people drink cow urine before entering Garba pandals

Actor Kalki Koechlin's interesting breakup tip: Sleep with someone and tell himIn an interview recently, Kalki Koechlin talked about her past and her experiences of having polyamorous relationships. The actor also shared an unusual breakup tip.

Tommy Shelby is back! Netflix's Peaky Blinders film officially starts productionThe Peaky Blinders film has officially started production, with Cillian Murphy back as Tommy Shelby. Creator Steven Knight and new cast member Barry Keoghan have also joined the project.

Squid Game 2: Actor Gong Yoo returns as the mysterious salesman in new teaserGong Yoo is set to return as the salesman in Squid Game Season 2, premiering on 26 December. The new season will feature both returning characters and new faces as they navigate the deadly survival game.
Mahima Chaudhry on 'dream debut' with SRK: I wasn't the most talentedActor Mahima Chaudhry recently spoke to us about her career and reminisced about her 'dream debut' with superstar Shah Rukh Khan.

sports.headline: Delhi Capitals co-owner GMR Group buys majority stake in Hampshire county teamThe co-owners of Delhi Capitals, the GMR Group, bought a majority stake in the Hampshire County cricket team. GMR group owns teams in various Twenty-20 leagues, including the IPL, Women's Premier League, and the SA20.

28-year-old Bengal cricketer Asif Hossain dies after falling from stairsBengal cricket was stunned by the untimely demise of 28-year-old cricketer Asif Hossain. Asif died after falling down from the stairs at his house.

IND vs AUS: 13-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi hits 58-ball hundred in youth Test India vs Australia, Under-19 Test: 13-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi of Bihari hit a hundred in 58 balls, impressing on his debut for the Under-19 team in the red-ball format. Vaibhav made his Ranji Trophy debut for Bihar at 12 earlier this year.

Ousmane Dembele controversy: PSG coach says he will drop player '100 more times'PSG manager Luis Enrique has said that he would drop star winger Ousmane Dembele 100 times over if it would help him make a better team. Dembele fell out with the manager just days ahead of the team's crucial Champions League clash against Arsenal.

Tamim Iqbal praises Rohit, Gambhir's 'champion mentality' in Kanpur TestFormer Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal praised Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir's champion mentality in the Kanpur Test match. India came out with aggressive intent with the bat and tried to force a result despite more than 2 days being washed out by rain.

Watch: Shan Masood's self-respect questioned, Pakistan media urged to show respectPakistan Test captain Shan Masood faced an awkward moment during a recent media interaction when a journalist controversially asked if he had considered quitting after a series of defeats. A clip of the exchange has been circulating on social media.

'Selfless approach and play to win': Manjrekar on Rohit Sharma's legacySanjay Manjrekar believes that Rohit Sharma has secured his legacy in Indian cricket for his selfless approach. Manjrekar said that Rohit only plays to win and should get the credit for India's new approach in Test cricket.

Rahul reveals how Rohit's message breathed life in rain-marred 2nd TestIndia vs Bangladesh: India revived their hopes for victory in the rain-marred second Test against Bangladesh, driven by an aggressive strategy inspired by captain Rohit Sharma's clear instructions, according to KL Rahul.

Gambhir's vision, Rohit's aggression: How India breathed life into Kanpur Test India vs Bangladesh: Rohit Sharma showed the way once again as India played Bazball Pro Max on Monday. They broke world records with the bat, scoring the fastest team 50, 100, 150, 200 and 250 to push for a favourable result, which looked improbable when two days were washed out due to wet weather in Kanpur.

Mohun Bagan SG decide against travelling to Iran keeping 'players safety in mind'Mohun Bagan Super Giant has decided not to travel to Iran for their AFC Champions League 2 match against Tractor FC, citing players' safety amid the volatile situation in the country. The club has requested the match to be rescheduled or moved to a neutral venue.

Inspired by India men's victory parade, Jemimah 'dreaming' before T20 World CupWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Jemimah Rodrigues, in an exclusive chat with Indiatoday.in, said that the Indian women's team has taken inspiration from the Indian men's success and will be looking to perform well in the ICC tournament in the United Arab Emirates.

Cricket South Africa approves Bangladesh tour, names Test squadCricket South Africa has confirmed a two-match Test series against Bangladesh, beginning October 21, after a thorough security review. The Proteas have also named a spin-heavy Test squad for the Bangladesh series.

Nasser Hussain calls for Joe Root's ODI return with Champions Trophy looming Nasser Hussain has called for Joe Root's return to the ODI side with the upcoming Champions Trophy in Pakistan. He sought more clarity over the roles of Ben Stokes and Root in ODI side.

Sachin Tendulkar set to return for inaugural International Masters LeagueThe International Masters League is set to bring cricket legends back on the field, reigniting old rivalries and delighting fans across the globe. With icons like Sachin Tendulkar and Sunil Gavaskar leading the charge, the tournament promises unforgettable action and nostalgia.

Stung by bee, Mehidy Hasan Miraz reveals funny incident in Kanpur TestIND vs BAN: Mehidy Hasan Miraz said that he was stung by a bee while batting. The 26-year-old scored 20 runs in the first innings of the Kanpur Test and built a 54-run partnership with Mominul Haque.

Great to see captain leading from front: Morkel hails Rohit's six-hitting spreeMorne Morkel hailed Rohit Sharma for his aggressive style of batting right from the start to set the tone for India's 1st innings. Rohit hit six sixes and a boundary as he scored 23 runs from 11 balls.

Ashwin, Jadeja make you work hard: Morne Morkel hails India spin duo IND vs BAN, 2nd Test: Bowling coach Morne Morkel said that Ravindra Jadeja and Ravi Ashwin can be dangerous customers to deal with and can be tough to score off when bowling in tandem.

Morne Morkel hails 'complete package' Ravindra Jadeja as he completes 300 wicketsMorne Morkel hailed Ravindra Jadeja as a complete package for his all-round skills in the red-ball format. Jadeja completed the 300 Test wickets milestone during India's 2nd Test against Bangladesh.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
